channel.title: Reverse on mfridman.com
channel.description: Recent content in Reverse on mfridman.com

item.title: coffee
item.description: Challenge: You found a suspicious USB drive in a jar of pickles. It contains this file $ file freeThePickles.class freeThePickles.class: compiled Java class data, version 52.0 (Java 1.8) Hint: Is there a way to get the source of the program? Although this challenge didn’t call for it, if you want to disassemble a class file use javap like so… javap -verbose freeThePickles.class > freeThePickles Anyways, back to the challenge. I used a “cloud-based” decompiler, javadecompilers.
